conclusion: To find the magnitude of the Ampere force received by the V-shaped current-carrying wire, we need to follow these steps.
The wire is bent into a V shape with equal side lengths and an included angle of 60°.

premise: The total length of the wire is 2l.
conclusion: Each side of the V shape is l.
The effective length of the wire in the direction of the magnetic field is the projection of the wire length onto the direction perpendicular to the magnetic field.
The effective length Leff is the sum of the projections of each side of the V shape onto the direction perpendicular to the magnetic field.

premise: Each side of the V shape has a length l.
conclusion: The projection of each side onto the direction perpendicular to the magnetic field is l sin(30°).

premise: The angle between each side and the perpendicular direction is 30°.
conclusion: The projection of each side is l sin(30°).

premise: The total effective length Leff is 2 × l sin(30°).

conclusion: The Ampere force F on a current-carrying wire in a magnetic field is given by F = B I Leff.
